text: , he was expressing the next morning , being at Hartfield again on business with Mr. Woodhouse , his approbation of the whole ; not so openly as he might have done had her father been out of the room , but speaking plain enough to be very intelligible to Emma . " A very pleasant evening , " he began , as soon as Mr. Woodhouse had been talked into what was necessary , told that he understood , and the papers swept away;--"particularly pleasant . You and Miss Fairfax gave us some very good music .

text: Well , that is so very!--I am sure if Jane is tired , you will be so kind as to give her your arm.--Mr . Elton , and Miss Hawkins!--Good morning to you . "
text_tokenized: Well , that is so very!--I am sure if Jane is tired , you will be so kind as to give her your arm.--Mr . Elton , and Miss Hawkins!--Good morning to you . "

text: Emma , alone with her father , had half her attention wanted by him while he lamented that young people would be in such a hurry to marry-- and to marry strangers too -- and the other half she could give to her own view of the subject . It was to herself an amusing and a very welcome piece of news , as proving that Mr. Elton could not have suffered long ; but she was sorry for Harriet :
text_tokenized: Emma , alone with her father , had half her attention wanted by him while he lamented that young people would be in such a hurry to marry-- and to marry strangers too -- and the other half she could give to her own view of the subject . It was to herself an amusing and a very welcome piece of news , as proving that Mr. Elton could not have suffered long ; but she was sorry for Harriet :

text: Harriet must feel it -- and all that she could hope was , by giving the first information herself , to save her from hearing it abruptly from others .
text_tokenized: Harriet must feel it -- and all that she could hope was , by giving the first information herself , to save her from hearing it abruptly from others .

text: It was now about the time that she was likely to call .
text_tokenized: It was now about the time that she was likely to call .

text: If she were to meet Miss Bates in her way!--and upon its beginning to rain , Emma was obliged to expect that the weather would be detaining her at Mrs. Goddard 's , and that the intelligence would undoubtedly rush upon her without preparation . The shower was heavy , but short ; and it had not been over five minutes , when in came Harriet , with just the heated , agitated look which hurrying thither with a full heart was likely to give ; and the " Oh ! Miss Woodhouse , what do you think has happened ! " which instantly burst forth , had all the evidence of corresponding perturbation .
text_tokenized: If she were to meet Miss Bates in her way!--and upon its beginning to rain , Emma was obliged to expect that the weather would be detaining her at Mrs. Goddard 's , and that the intelligence would undoubtedly rush upon her without preparation . The shower was heavy , but short ; and it had not been over five minutes , when in came Harriet , with just the heated , agitated look which hurrying thither with a full heart was likely to give ; and the " Oh ! Miss Woodhouse , what do you think has happened ! " which instantly burst forth , had all the evidence of corresponding perturbation .

text: As the blow was given , Emma felt that she could not now shew greater kindness than in listening ; and Harriet , unchecked , ran eagerly through what she had to tell .
text_tokenized: As the blow was given , Emma felt that she could not now shew greater kindness than in listening ; and Harriet , unchecked , ran eagerly through what she had to tell .

text: " She had set out from Mrs. Goddard 's half an hour ago -- she had been afraid it would rain -- she had been afraid it would pour down every moment -- but she thought she might get to Hartfield first -- she had hurried on as fast as possible ; but then , as she was passing by the house where a young woman was making up a gown for her , she thought she would just step in and see how it went on ; and though she did not seem to stay half a moment there , soon after she came out it began to rain , and she did not know what to do ; so she ran on directly , as fast as she could , and took shelter at Ford's . "--Ford 's was the principal woollen - draper , linen - draper , and haberdasher 's shop united ; the shop first in size and fashion in the place.--"And so , there she had set , without an idea of any thing in the world , full ten minutes , perhaps -- when , all of a sudden , who should come in-- to be sure it was so very odd!--but they always dealt at Ford's-- who should come in , but Elizabeth Martin and her brother!-- Dear Miss Woodhouse ! only think .
text_tokenized: " She had set out from Mrs. Goddard 's half an hour ago -- she had been afraid it would rain -- she had been afraid it would pour down every moment -- but she thought she might get to Hartfield first -- she had hurried on as fast as possible ; but then , as she was passing by the house where a young woman was making up a gown for her , she thought she would just step in and see how it went on ; and though she did not seem to stay half a moment there , soon after she came out it began to rain , and she did not know what to do ; so she ran on directly , as fast as she could , and took shelter at Ford's . "--Ford 's was the principal woollen - draper , linen - draper , and haberdasher 's shop united ; the shop first in size and fashion in the place.--"And so , there she had set , without an idea of any thing in the world , full ten minutes , perhaps -- when , all of a sudden , who should come in-- to be sure it was so very odd!--but they always dealt at Ford's-- who should come in , but Elizabeth Martin and her brother!-- Dear Miss Woodhouse ! only think .

text: I thought I should have fainted .
text_tokenized: I thought I should have fainted .

text: I did not know what to do .
text_tokenized: I did not know what to do .

text: I was sitting near the door -- Elizabeth saw me directly ; but he did not ; he was busy with the umbrella .
text_tokenized: I was sitting near the door -- Elizabeth saw me directly ; but he did not ; he was busy with the umbrella .

text: I am sure she saw me , but she looked away directly , and took no notice ; and they both went to quite the farther end of the shop ;
text_tokenized: I am sure she saw me , but she looked away directly , and took no notice ; and they both went to quite the farther end of the shop ;

text: and I kept sitting near the door!--Oh !
text_tokenized: and I kept sitting near the door!--Oh !

text: dear ; I was so miserable !
text_tokenized: dear ; I was so miserable !

text: I am sure I must have been as white as my gown .
text_tokenized: I am sure I must have been as white as my gown .

text: I could not go away you know , because of the rain ; but I did so wish myself anywhere in the world but there.--Oh !
text_tokenized: I could not go away you know , because of the rain ; but I did so wish myself anywhere in the world but there.--Oh !

text: dear , Miss Woodhouse -- well , at last , I fancy , he looked round and saw me ; for instead of going on with her buyings , they began whispering to one another .
text_tokenized: dear , Miss Woodhouse -- well , at last , I fancy , he looked round and saw me ; for instead of going on with her buyings , they began whispering to one another .

text: I am sure they were talking of me ; and I could not help thinking that he was persuading her to speak to me--(do you think he was , Miss Woodhouse?)--for presently she came forward -- came quite up to me , and asked me how I did , and seemed ready to shake hands , if I would . She did not do any of it in the same way that she used ; I could see she was altered ; but , however , she seemed to _ try _ to be very friendly , and we shook hands , and stood talking some time ; but I know no more what I said -- I was in such a tremble!--I remember she said she was sorry we never met now ; which I thought almost too kind !
text_tokenized: I am sure they were talking of me ; and I could not help thinking that he was persuading her to speak to me--(do you think he was , Miss Woodhouse?)--for presently she came forward -- came quite up to me , and asked me how I did , and seemed ready to shake hands , if I would . She did not do any of it in the same way that she used ; I could see she was altered ; but , however , she seemed to _ try _ to be very friendly , and we shook hands , and stood talking some time ; but I know no more what I said -- I was in such a tremble!--I remember she said she was sorry we never met now ; which I thought almost too kind !

text: Dear , Miss Woodhouse , I was absolutely miserable !
text_tokenized: Dear , Miss Woodhouse , I was absolutely miserable !

text: By that time , it was beginning to hold up , and I was determined
text_tokenized: By that time , it was beginning to hold up , and I was determined

text: that nothing should stop me from getting away
text_tokenized: that nothing should stop me from getting away

text: and then -- only think!--
text_tokenized: and then -- only think!--

text: I found he was coming up towards me too -- slowly you know , and as if he did not quite know what to do ; and so he came and spoke , and I answered -- and I stood for a minute , feeling dreadfully , you know , one ca n't tell how ; and then I took courage , and said it did not rain , and I must go ; and so off I set ; and I had not got three yards from the door , when he came after me , only to say , if I was going to Hartfield , he thought I had much better go round by Mr. Cole 's stables , for I should find the near way quite floated by this rain .
text_tokenized: I found he was coming up towards me too -- slowly you know , and as if he did not quite know what to do ; and so he came and spoke , and I answered -- and I stood for a minute , feeling dreadfully , you know , one ca n't tell how ; and then I took courage , and said it did not rain , and I must go ; and so off I set ; and I had not got three yards from the door , when he came after me , only to say , if I was going to Hartfield , he thought I had much better go round by Mr. Cole 's stables , for I should find the near way quite floated by this rain .

text: Oh !
text_tokenized: Oh !

text: dear , I thought it would have been the death of me !
text_tokenized: dear , I thought it would have been the death of me !

text: So I said , I was very much obliged to him : you know I could not do less ; and then he went back to Elizabeth , and I came round
text_tokenized: So I said , I was very much obliged to him : you know I could not do less ; and then he went back to Elizabeth , and I came round

text: by the stables -- I believe I did -- but I hardly knew where I was , or any thing about it .
text_tokenized: by the stables -- I believe I did -- but I hardly knew where I was , or any thing about it .

text: Oh !
text_tokenized: Oh !

text: Miss Woodhouse , I would rather done any thing than have it happen : and yet , you know , there was a sort of satisfaction in seeing him behave so pleasantly and so kindly .
text_tokenized: Miss Woodhouse , I would rather done any thing than have it happen : and yet , you know , there was a sort of satisfaction in seeing him behave so pleasantly and so kindly .

text: And Elizabeth , too .
text_tokenized: And Elizabeth , too .

text: Oh !
text_tokenized: Oh !

text: Miss Woodhouse , do talk to me and make me comfortable again .
text_tokenized: Miss Woodhouse , do talk to me and make me comfortable again .

text: " Very sincerely did Emma wish to do so ; but it was not immediately in her power .
text_tokenized: " Very sincerely did Emma wish to do so ; but it was not immediately in her power .

text: She was obliged to stop and think .
text_tokenized: She was obliged to stop and think .

text: She was not thoroughly comfortable herself . The young man 's conduct , and his sister 's , seemed the result of real feeling , and she could not but pity them .
text_tokenized: She was not thoroughly comfortable herself . The young man 's conduct , and his sister 's , seemed the result of real feeling , and she could not but pity them .

text: As Harriet described it , there had been an interesting mixture of wounded affection and genuine delicacy in their behaviour .
text_tokenized: As Harriet described it , there had been an interesting mixture of wounded affection and genuine delicacy in their behaviour .

text: But she had believed them to be well - meaning , worthy people before ; and what difference did this make in the evils of the connexion ? It was folly to be disturbed by it .
text_tokenized: But she had believed them to be well - meaning , worthy people before ; and what difference did this make in the evils of the connexion ? It was folly to be disturbed by it .

text: Of course , he must be sorry to lose her -- they must be all sorry .
text_tokenized: Of course , he must be sorry to lose her -- they must be all sorry .

text: Ambition , as well as love , had probably been mortified .
text_tokenized: Ambition , as well as love , had probably been mortified .

text: They might all have hoped to rise by Harriet 's acquaintance : and besides , what was the value of Harriet 's description?--So easily pleased -- so little discerning;-- what signified her praise ?
text_tokenized: They might all have hoped to rise by Harriet 's acquaintance : and besides , what was the value of Harriet 's description?--So easily pleased -- so little discerning;-- what signified her praise ?

text: She exerted herself , and did try to make her comfortable , by considering all that had passed as a mere trifle , and quite unworthy of being dwelt on , " It might be distressing , for the moment , " said she ; " but you seem to have behaved extremely well ; and it is over -- and may never-- can never , as a first meeting , occur again , and therefore you need not think about it . "
text_tokenized: She exerted herself , and did try to make her comfortable , by considering all that had passed as a mere trifle , and quite unworthy of being dwelt on , " It might be distressing , for the moment , " said she ; " but you seem to have behaved extremely well ; and it is over -- and may never-- can never , as a first meeting , occur again , and therefore you need not think about it . "

text: Harriet said , " very true , " and she " would not think about it ; " but still she talked of it -- still she could talk of nothing else ; and Emma , at last , in order to put the Martins out of her head , was obliged to hurry on the news , which she had meant to give with so much tender caution ; hardly knowing herself whether to rejoice or be angry , ashamed or only amused , at such a state of mind in poor Harriet -- such a conclusion of Mr. Elton 's importance with her !
text_tokenized: Harriet said , " very true , " and she " would not think about it ; " but still she talked of it -- still she could talk of nothing else ; and Emma , at last , in order to put the Martins out of her head , was obliged to hurry on the news , which she had meant to give with so much tender caution ; hardly knowing herself whether to rejoice or be angry , ashamed or only amused , at such a state of mind in poor Harriet -- such a conclusion of Mr. Elton 's importance with her !

text: Mr. Elton 's rights , however , gradually revived .
text_tokenized: Mr. Elton 's rights , however , gradually revived .

text: Though she did not feel the first intelligence as she might have done the day before , or an hour before , its interest soon increased ; and before their first conversation was over , she had talked herself into all the sensations of curiosity , wonder and regret , pain and pleasure , as to this fortunate Miss Hawkins , which could conduce to place the Martins under proper subordination in her fancy . Emma learned to be rather glad that there had been such a meeting .
text_tokenized: Though she did not feel the first intelligence as she might have done the day before , or an hour before , its interest soon increased ; and before their first conversation was over , she had talked herself into all the sensations of curiosity , wonder and regret , pain and pleasure , as to this fortunate Miss Hawkins , which could conduce to place the Martins under proper subordination in her fancy . Emma learned to be rather glad that there had been such a meeting .

text: It had been serviceable in deadening the first shock , without retaining any influence to alarm .
text_tokenized: It had been serviceable in deadening the first shock , without retaining any influence to alarm .

text: As Harriet now lived , the Martins could not get at her , without seeking her , where hitherto they had wanted either the courage or the condescension to seek her ; for since her refusal of the brother , the sisters never had been at Mrs. Goddard 's ; and a twelvemonth might pass without their being thrown together again , with any necessity , or even any power of speech .
text_tokenized: As Harriet now lived , the Martins could not get at her , without seeking her , where hitherto they had wanted either the courage or the condescension to seek her ; for since her refusal of the brother , the sisters never had been at Mrs. Goddard 's ; and a twelvemonth might pass without their being thrown together again , with any necessity , or even any power of speech .
